metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3117 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Duplicate of CVE-2023-3390.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-78-generic - 5.15.0-78.85
linux-image-5.15.0-78-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-78.85
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-78-generic - 5.15.0-78.85
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-78-generic-64k - 5.15.0-78.85
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-50-generic - 5.19.0-50.50
linux-image-5.19.0-50-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-50.50
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-50-generic - 5.19.0-50.50

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-78.85').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-50.50').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1038.43').

linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1040.45').
